item.title: My Completed Java with opengl and slick Game
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“Techkid, post:25, topic:533313”][quote author=Wintercanon link=topic=652107.msg4372796#msg4372796 date=1381197956]
There’s no way you wrote this in one night… It’s amazing.
[/quote]
^ pretty sure this guy said tht… Anyways what are you on about? This was my first game give me a break, you can’t expect me to go make the next minecraft.[/quote]

Haha I think he was being a sarcastic dick like most people here. But don’t let it get to you, it’s the internet. But on comments like:

[quote=“Techkid, post:23, topic:533313”][quote author=Int Bauk link=topic=652107.msg4373450#msg4373450 date=1381437354]
you’ve created a lot of image constants which aren’t needed as well as a bunch of others
[/quote]
This was my first java game… I wrote this in one night by the way so this code is nothing compared to how I actually code. I crashed this game and started a new one. Whoever said “there’s no way i did this in one night, it’s amazing”, < this is the worst game I have ever made.[/quote]

Don’t get offended because he took time out of his day to read your code and offer advice to make it better. No one is going to be impressed by your first game, but help is always available.

Read full topic

item.title: My Completed Java with opengl and slick Game
item.dc:creator: @Techkid Techkid
item.description:
@Techkid wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:8, topic:533313”]Moving this out of the programming section. Post source code if you want it back here.

edit: and whats with the height map hes walking on lol.[/quote]
SOURCE CODE: Game.java [code]
package javagame;

import org.newdawn.slick.;
import org.newdawn.slick.state.;

public class Game extends StateBasedGame{

public static final String gamename = “Jeam Beta! 1.0”;
public static final int menu = 0;
public static final int play = 1;
public static final int HEIGHT = 360;
public static final int WIDTH = 640;

public Game(String gamename){
super(gamename);
this.addState(new Menu(menu));
this.addState(new Play(play));
}

public void initStatesList(GameContainer gc) throws SlickException{
this.getState(menu).init(gc, this);
this.getState(play).init(gc, this);
this.enterState(menu);
}

public static void main(String[] args){
AppGameContainer appgc;
try{
appgc = new AppGameContainer(new Game(gamename));
appgc.setDisplayMode(WIDTH, HEIGHT, false);
appgc.start();
}catch(SlickException e){
e.printStackTrace();
}
}

}
[/code]
Play.java

package main;

import org.newdawn.slick.Animation;
import org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer;
import org.newdawn.slick.Graphics;
import org.newdawn.slick.Image;
import org.newdawn.slick.Input;
import org.newdawn.slick.SlickException;
import org.newdawn.slick.state.BasicGameState;
import org.newdawn.slick.state.StateBasedGame;

public class Play extends BasicGameState{
	Image left;
	Image right;
	Image up;
	Image down;
	Image worldMap;
	public boolean quit = false;
	int[] duration = {200, 200};
	float gameSX = 0;
	float gameSY = 0;
	float shiftX = gameSX + 320;
	float shiftY = gameSY + 160;
	
	Animation stew, movingUp, movingDown, movingLeft, movingRight;
	
	public Play(int state) {
	}

	public void init(GameContainer gc, StateBasedGame sbg)
			throws SlickException {
		right = new Image("res/right.png"); 
		left = new Image("res/left.png");
		up = new Image("res/up.png");
		down = new Image("res/down.png");
		worldMap = new Image("res/world.png");
		worldMap = new Image("res/world.png");
		Image[] walkUp = { new Image("res/down.png"),
				new Image("res/up.png") }; // these are the images to be
													// used in the "walkUp"
													// animation
		Image[] WalkDown = { new Image("res/up.png"),
				new Image("res/down.png") };
		Image[] WalkLeft = { new Image("res/left.png"),
				new Image("res/left.png") };
		Image[] WalkRight = {new Image("res/right.png"),
				new Image("res/right.png") };
		movingUp = new Animation(walkUp, duration, false); // each animation
															// takes array of
															// images, duration
															// for each image,
															// and autoUpdate
															// (just set to
															// false)
		movingDown = new Animation(WalkDown, duration, false);
		movingLeft = new Animation(WalkLeft, duration, false);
		movingRight = new Animation(WalkRight, duration, false);
		stew = movingDown;
		// by default as soon as game loads, stew will be
	}

	public void render(GameContainer gc, StateBasedGame sbg, Graphics g)
			throws SlickException {
		worldMap.draw(gameSX, gameSY);// draw the map at 0,0 to
		// start

		stew.draw(320, 160); // draw bucky at 320, 160 (center of the
		// screen)
		g.drawString("Stewart's X: " + gameSX + "\nStewart's Y: "
				+ gameSY, 400, 20); // indicator to see where bucky is in
		// his world

		
		
	}


	public void update(GameContainer gc, StateBasedGame sbg, int delta)
			throws SlickException {
		Input input = gc.getInput();

		// during the game if the user hits the up arrow...
		if (input.isKeyDown(Input.KEY_UP)) {
			stew = movingUp; // change bucky to up image
			gameSY += delta * .1f; // increase the Y coordinates of bucky
											// (move him up)
			if (gameSY > 162) {
				gameSY -= delta * .1f; // dont let him keep going up if
												// he reaches the top
			}
		}
		if (input.isKeyDown(Input.KEY_DOWN)) {
			stew = movingDown;
			gameSY -= delta * .1f;
			if (gameSY < -390) {
				gameSY += delta * .1f;
			}
		}
		if (input.isKeyDown(Input.KEY_LEFT)) {
			stew = movingLeft;
			gameSX += delta * .1f;
			if (gameSX > 324) {
				gameSX -= delta * .1f;
			}

		}
		if (input.isKeyDown(Input.KEY_RIGHT)) {
			stew = movingRight;
			gameSX -= delta * .1f;
			if (gameSX < -442) {
				gameSX += delta * .1f;
			}
		}

		// escape
		if (input.isKeyDown(Input.KEY_ESCAPE)) {
			quit = true;
		}

		// when they hit escape
		if (quit == true) {
			if (input.isKeyDown(Input.KEY_R)) {
				quit = false;
			}
			if (input.isKeyDown(Input.KEY_M)) {
				sbg.enterState(0);
				try {
					Thread.sleep(250);
				} catch (InterruptedException e) {
					e.printStackTrace();
				}
			}
			if (input.isKeyDown(Input.KEY_Q)) {
				System.exit(0);
			}
			//if(input.isKeyDown(Input.KEY_C)){
				//sbg.enterState(2);
			//}
		}
		
	}

	public int getID() {
		return 1;
	}

}

Menu.java

package javagame;

import org.lwjgl.input.Mouse;
import org.newdawn.slick.*;
import org.newdawn.slick.state.*;

public class Menu extends BasicGameState {

	public Image playNow;
	public Image exitGame;
	public Image Home;



	public Menu(int state) {
		
	}

	

	public void init(GameContainer gc, StateBasedGame sbg)
			throws SlickException {
		playNow = new Image("res/playNow.png");
		exitGame = new Image("res/exitGame.png");
		Home = new Image("res/home.png");
		
		

	}
	
		
		
	

	public void render(GameContainer gc, StateBasedGame sbg, Graphics g)
			throws SlickException {
		g.drawString("Welcome to Stewart Land!", 100, 50);
		//Image anim = new Image("res/background.png");
		//g.drawImage(anim, 2, 2);

		playNow.draw(100, 100);
		exitGame.draw(100, 200);
		g.drawString("Beware of the Game as you are forwarned", 250,300);
		
		
		
	}

	public void update(GameContainer gc, StateBasedGame sbg, int delta)
			throws SlickException {
		int posX = Mouse.getX();
		int posY = Mouse.getY();
		// play now button
		if ((posX > 100 && posX < 311) && (posY > 209 && posY < 260)) {
			if (Mouse.isButtonDown(0)) {
				sbg.enterState(1);
			}
		}
		// exit game
		if ((posX > 100 && posX < 311) && (posY > 109 && posY < 160)) {
			if (Mouse.isButtonDown(0)) {
				System.exit(0);
			}
		}
	}

	public int getID() {
		return 0;
	}
}

Read full topic
